What are the key changes and requirements associated with the Verus v0.7.2-1 node and wallet upgrade, and how does it affect the testnet and mainnet?

The Verus v0.7.2-1 node and wallet upgrade is a non-mandatory but highly recommended update that brings significant changes to the Verus testnet and mainnet. 

**Testnet Changes:**
The testnet has been reset and relaunched on v0.7.2, which means that users who have last launched VRSCTEST from a version prior to v0.7.2 must follow specific instructions before running this update. This upgrade activates a fully decentralized finance and liquidity system on the new Verus testnet, allowing users to participate in a more advanced and robust testing environment.

**Mainnet Improvements:**
While the main focus of this release is on the testnet, the mainnet support also benefits from some performance improvements. Additionally, this update fixes an issue that may occur in an edge case of revocation and recovery of IDs, which can result in a revoked ID being irrecoverable from earlier versions than v0.7.2. This fix ensures that ID revocation and recovery processes are more reliable and secure on the mainnet.

**Signature Verification:**
The update also includes a feature to verify signatures, which will return `true` if the signature is valid. This is an essential component of ensuring the integrity and security of transactions on the Verus network.

Overall, the Verus v0.7.2-1 node and wallet upgrade is a significant step forward for the Verus ecosystem, providing a more robust and secure testing environment and improving the overall performance and reliability of the mainnet.

**The result will be true if the signature is valid.**
```
true
```
**This update is required to continue participating on the testnet launched in v0.7.2**Verus v0.7.2-1 is a non-mandatory but highly recommended Verus node and wallet upgrade, with fully decentralized finance and liquidity system activated on the new Verus testnet. While most of the new capabilities in this release are focused on testnet, the mainnet support does include some performance improvements and also fixes an issue that may occur in an edge case of revocation and recovery of IDs, which can result in a revoked ID being irrecoverable from an earlier version than v0.7.2.## Testnet Reset
The testnet was deleted and relaunched on v0.7.2. **IF YOU HAVE LAST LAUNCHED VRSCTEST FROM A VERSION PRIOR TO v0.7.2, PLEASE FOLLOW THE INSTRUCTIONS AT THE BOTTOM OF THE RELEASE NOTES BEFORE RUNNING THIS UPDATE**
